meanings.sent1: She only had a fractional amount of cake left.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the fractional part of the math problem.
meanings.sent3: He felt like a fractional piece of the puzzle, not knowing the full picture.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a fractional glimpse of happiness in a sea of sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The fractional slices of pizza disappeared quickly at the party.

meanings.definition: A small or tiny part or amount.
meanings.sent1: He only needed a fractional of the total to complete the project.
meanings.sent2: The fractional of the donation went towards helping the community.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored every fractional of the acorn for the winter.
meanings.sent4: In the vast desert, each drop of water was a precious fractional of life.
meanings.sent5: The artist focused on every fractional of detail in the painting.
